results.title: The Child molester
results.creator_credit: HSF Safety and Training and Herbert J. Leder
results.brief_description: Emphasises the dangers of attack on children and dramatizes typical approaches. The film shows what can be done to reduce the problem by making children aware of molesters and the precautions to be taken when accosted by strangers.

results.title: The Child in the middle
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles. Dept. of Theater Arts, Gerard Schaefer and Merrill S. Brody
results.brief_description: Underlines the importance of co-operation by parents and teachers in reaching understanding of children’s problems. In a dramatised example (based on an actual case), Martha causes concern to her teacher when she withdraws from school work and school contacts. The teacher discovers that Martha is throwing away the lunch cut by her grandmother, who also figures oddly in Martha’s free expression art work. Discussion with the parents and the headmistress clears the way for Martha’s readjustment to school life.

results.title: The Child and the saw
results.creator_credit: IKON (GB), Richard Heslop and Daniel Landin
results.brief_description: The child sleeps. It is the morning of her birthday. She chooses her favourite shoes and her special dress. She is nine years old today. A parcel arrives. The saw has come. They played and they played and played. And then the inevitable happened.

results.title: The Cherry blossom trail
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger and Grainger Television Australia
results.brief_description: Essentially a travel video, “The Cherry blossom trail” uses the revered time of beauty in Japan - Hanami (the brief period of time in which the cherry blossoms, known as sakura, flower before being driven away by the rain - as a compass for this tour of Japan. Beginning in Kyushu, host Greg Grainger and his guide/interpreter Ian visit a shinto shrine, observe the superstitions surrounding Japan’s national flower, visit a canola crop, hot sands and natural springs, countryside walkways, samurai village, origami cranes in the peace park, a traditional tea ceremony, sake and pottery production, geishas, sumo school, traditional villages and a seventeenth century castle, all set against the backdrop of exquisite flowers and gardens. The journey ends at Mount Fuji.

results.title: The Chemistry of digestion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Nutrient molecules in food are too large to be absorbed into the body. Through the chemical processes of digestion, these nutrients are split into small, component molecules that can be absorbed. Animation, X-ray footage and laboratory demonstrations illustrate the major steps in the digestion of carbohydrates, fats and proteins.

results.title: The Chemical dream
results.creator_credit: Edward Goldwyn and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Looks at the research and utilization of enzymes in industry and the mass production of bacteria that produce specific enzymes. Also the production of sugar from carbohydrate source is discussed, together with its implications in the sugar-cane industry. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Chelsea Flower Show (Captioned)
results.brief_description: It was in 1913 that the Royal Horticultural Society moved its Great Spring Show from the Temple Gardens to the Royal Chelsea Hospital. This commemorative video looks back over the last 75 golden years and illustrates this fascinating history with period photographs, film and music. Rated: G

results.title: The Chateau country
results.creator_credit: Vavin and French Government Tourist Office
results.brief_description: A tour of the Renaissance castles of the Loire Valley. Rambouillet, summer residence of the French President; Blois, with its historical associations; Chateau Renault, court of the Valois and Orleans kings; Amboise with the chapel of St Hubert; Chinon, associated with Joan of Arc; and much more.

results.title: The Chase
results.creator_credit: Shaun Elstob, Anutaro Tantraporn, John Sharpe, Gillian Morisson and Sharon Parker
results.brief_description: A man snatches a baby off its mother as she leaves a train station. Distraught, she pursues and then attacks him. But how maternal are her instincts to protect her ‘bundle of joy’?
